instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Hi!

No power, orange light.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground.  <CAPACITOR>C7431</CAPACITOR>:1  was bad. I removed it now the short is gone.  It is ok if I don't replace it. I don't have a donor board now. 

thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Machine can work without it.
However, easy to find 68uF on different MacBook scrap boards.
Even 33uF is better than nothing...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Hi!

F7140  voltage on pad 2 was 0.1 the fuse got no continuity, so I soldered a Wire between Pad1 and pad2. (correct me if this is bad) I don't have donor boards yet.

Fan Spin sometimes spin or start spinning after several minutes. No chime or image

Here are some voltages!

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>  16.5 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>    3.4 V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>      8.6 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>           3.3 V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>       5 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>         3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL>            1.2 V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL>             1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>            0.08V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>   0.00V
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>   0.27 V

I thing CPU is not being powered.

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> goes high?
Any voltage at L7430/630?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
I'm not sure what a "goes high' means but it reads 3.3V

So 

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>     3.3v
L7430                  1.2v
L7630                  0.08 v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 12, 16, 17, 6.
Be sure to have good components and traces on its area.

Just in case, check L7630 diode mode to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Somehow  soldering paste landed on <CAPACITOR>C7616</CAPACITOR> bonding both paths. MacBook is up and running now. 

What exactly <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> is for? CPU's power supply? 
Where can I find info about each ic is for?
I got info about most of them but there are a lot that still ignore.

Thanks again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
